metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4264 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 7u60 and 8u5 allows remoteattackers to affect availability via unknown vectors related to Security.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4264` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1
openjdk-7-source - 7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u65-2.5.1-1ubuntu1~0.14.04.1').
